title: Saskatchewan Roughriders Win Fifth Grey Cup, Defeat Montreal 25-17
snippets: Trevor Harris was named the Grey Cup MVP after the Roughriders won their fifth Grey Cup with a 25-17 victory over Montreal at Princess Auto Stadium.
The Roughriders won their fifth Grey Cup title with a clutch late defensive stand to defeat the Alouettes 25-17 in Winnipeg.
Trevor Harris put together a historic performance that helped Saskatchewan Roughriders earn their fifth Grey Cup title and their first since 2013.
Sean Reynolds and Justin Dunk discuss the 112th edition of the Grey Cup after Trevor Harris led the Saskatchewan Roughriders to victory over the Montreal Alouettes.
Roughriders win Grey Cup with 25-17 victory over Alouettes The Globe and Mail
Trevor Harris threw for 302 yards en route to MVP honours and the Saskatchewan Roughriders defence forced four turnovers to defeat the Montreal Alouettes 25-17 in the 112th Grey Cup.

The Saskatchewan Roughriders are Grey Cup Champions for the fifth time in their long history. The Riders would dominate the Alouettes for the majority of the game, scoring 24 straight points before the Alouettes attempted a late rally, which would come up short on a fumble that was forced by Tevaugh
Saskatchewan Roughriders’ Trevor Harris reflects on the team’s overcoming adversity to win the Grey Cup and touches on why he’s happy to take home the championship to a much-deserving fanbase.

Saskatchewan Roughriders running back A.J. Ouellette joins Sean Reynolds after his team’s 25-17 win in the 112th Grey Cup, discussing the poise displayed by the group and how they approached the big game.
The Saskatchewan Roughriders are presented the 2025 Grey Cup after defeating the Montreal Alouettes 25-17.

WINNIPEG — The Saskatchewan Roughriders’ first Grey Cup win in 12 years had green confetti raining down on the field at Winnipeg’s Princess Auto Stadium and green-and-white clad fans spilling out onto the street in pure merriment. The Prairie team beat the Montreal Alouettes 25-17 to take the cup on

summary: The Saskatchewan Roughriders won their fifth Grey Cup title, defeating the Montreal Alouettes 25-17. Dominating for most of the game and scoring 24 straight points, their victory marks their first championship since 2013. Trevor Harris, named MVP, led the team with his first Grey Cup win as a starting quarterback, contributing to the victory with 23-of-27 passes for 302 yards.

Jannik Sinner saw off close rival Carlos Alcaraz to clinch the ATP Finals title with a 7-6 (7-4) 7-5 victory after the Spaniard struggled with a hamstring injury.

The final installment of the “Sincaraz” rivalry for 2025 went to Jannik Sinner. The second-ranked Sinner beat the top-ranked Carlos Alcaraz 7-6 (4), 7-5 for the ATP Finals trophy on Sunday in the sixth meeting this year between the two players who are dominating men’s tennis.
